text:
The Ranheim player has started everything in recent years. Replaced by debutant in fate
Debutant Magnus Lenes has to step in against StabÃ¦k after Even Barli suffered a concussion on Viking on Wednesday.
03 Nov 2019, 15:53 by Vegard Bjelland
EXTRA ARENA: Even Barli has been the undisputed first choice at the back of the field at Ranheim in recent years. The head injury he sustained against Viking in midweek prevents him on Sunday in the fight for life.
Ranheim's solid last chance has stood all series matches this year, last year, 2017 and 2016. Thus, it is a patient Magnus Lenes who gets his baptism of fire in the Elite series on Sunday.
The 23-year-old has faced three cup games this year, plus jumped into the cup against Viking on Wednesday.
It's not just the back of the field that Svein Maalen needs to make changes. In the fight against the Viking, Daniel Kvande had to leave after feeling a stretch in the back of the thigh, an injury that also puts him out of the StabÃ¦k fight.
Mads Reginiussen and Vegard Erlien were also injured, but can be found in the starting lineup.

Ranheim's key players had to go out one by one: - I have no memory of the situation



Magnus Lenes has zero minutes on the pitch in the Elite Series.ğŸ“· Carina Johansen

Win or disappear
Ranheim is in the elite series before Sunday's settlement in the Elite series. But hope is not out, as there are only two points up to safe space.
The loss to TromsÃ¸ last weekend is still on the verge, and it is up to Ranheim to keep the place. In the remaining four matches they meet StabÃ¦k, MjÃ¸ndalen, LillestrÃ¸m and Rosenborg.
StabÃ¦k was at the bottom for much of the season, but after former RBK coach Jan JÃ¶nsson came in and rolled into the machinery the club from BÃ¦rum climbed and are in 10th place with 30 points.

The Ranheim players were far below the cupexit: - This was possibly my last chance to win something in the career

This is how Ranheim poses
Svein Maalen is forced to make several changes, but has managed to stack a powerful layer on his legs.
Mushaga Bakenga is referred to the bench and Michael Karlsen who turned out his best side against Odd two weeks ago gets the opportunity from the start.
How to start Ranheim (4-3â€“3): Magnus Lenes - JÃ¸rgen Olsen Ã˜veraas, TorbjÃ¸rn Heggem, Ivar Furu, Aleksander FoosnÃ¦s - Olaus Skarsem, Magnus Blakstad, Mads Reginiussen - Ã˜yvind Storflor, Michael Karlsen, Vegard Erlien
The bench: Mathias Bjerke Sellesbakk, Sander Saugestad, Mushaga Bakenga, Erlend SÃ¸rhÃ¸y, Eirik Valla DÃ¸nnem, Adria Mateo Lopes and Ola Solbakken.
